121.title: Hindu ascetic rising from the river after a holy dip is emblematic of Maha Kumbh festival in India
121.summary:
The man appears in a silhouette after rising from the river. His dreadlocked hair is flicked backwards, sending a stream of water in a clockwise swirl. Others surround him, with some holding the saffron flag of Hinduism, all repeating a centuries-old ritual that Hindus believe cleanses them of their sins and releases them from the cycle of rebirth.

The photo of a Naga Sadhu — a Hindu ascetic — at the confluence of the Ganges, Yamuna and mythical Saraswati rivers in the northern city of Prayagraj, is emblematic of the ongoing Maha Kumbh festival, the largest religious congregation on Earth. Here, millions Hindus have been taking dips in freezing water at the confluence of rivers — two worldly and one mythical — to attain salvation.

Bathing at the festival, which began on Jan. 13 and will conclude on Feb. 26, takes place every day, but on the most auspicious dates, Hindu ascetics charge toward the holy rivers at dawn. They are part of religious orders that were once mercenary armies...

223.title: British composer Leo Geyer on documenting the lost music of Auschwitz
223.summary: It's being called the lost music of Auschwitz. A British composer has spoken to FRANCE 24 about his chance discovery of pages of compositions by prisoners at the Auschwitz death camp in Nazi-occupied Poland. The works were often put together by people who did not survive the camp's horrors. Leo Geyer has spent the last decade researching and documenting the compositions, amid his quest to ensure that the music lives on. He spoke to us in Perspective.
223.author: Stuart NORVAL

224.title: 'Arctic split into two: Greenland finds itself geographically, politically, economically in middle'
224.summary: EU leaders are gathering amid Europe’s biggest land conflict since World War II. All the while, European confidence in Trump has been waning as he threatens allies with tariffs and land grabs targeting Greenland and Panama. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective on the EU leaders' first-ever meeting focused purely on defence, FRANCE 24's Gavin Lee welcomes Klaus Dodds, Professor of Geopolitics and Executive Dean for the School of Life Sciences and Environment at Royal Holloway, and University lead for environmental sustainability. He has also been a Visiting Professor at the College of Europe, Warsaw Poland.
224.author: FRANCE24

225.title: Kenya's Sengwer community refuses to leave Embobut Forest
225.summary: Kenya's Sengwer community is one of the last to live in the Embobut Forest, in the North Rift Valley. But the government accuses this Indigenous people of damaging the forest and has asked them to leave. Hundreds of families have been forcibly evicted. The Sengwer, whose ancestral way of life is under threat, accuse the authorities of deliberately burning down their homes and are refusing to leave. Our correspondents Olivia Bizot and Bastien Renouil report.

Meanwhile, North America's highly integrated auto manufacturing sector is threatened by Trump's latest trade salvo, and markets tank as investors flee high-risk assets.

The IDF says it has found what it calls terrorist infrastructure in Tulkarm. But residents of the neighbourhood say only families live there, who are being unfairly targeted and inhumanely treated.

Meanwhile, residents of Kyiv are forced to withstand nightly Russian drone attacks. Also, a Ukrainian unit in Kursk is tasked with trying to get locals to abandon their loyalties to Vladimir Putin. Finally, perhaps the biggest trade in basketball history nearly breaks the internet, as Luka Doncic becomes a Los Angeles Laker.

Reporting from Jerusalem, FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky says the Israeli army continues to deny that it has issued evacuation orders for camp residents, but “it appears that more than 20,000 people have left the Jenin refugee camp".

383.author: Kate Linthicum, Tracy Wilkinson

384.title: Calmes: Trump's focus on retribution distracts from the nation's real domestic enemies
384.summary: The new president's enemies aren't America's enemies. If the FBI turns to retribution, what will protect us from the real threats that endanger the nation?
384.author: Jackie Calmes

385.title: Trump and Biden add to long, strange history of presidential pardons
385.summary: Trump's clemency for Jan. 6 rioters and Biden's reprieve for family represent merely the latest chapters in an odd history of the presidential pardon.
385.author: David Wharton

386.title: Is Xavier Becerra's next move running for governor? He's not saying. Yet.
386.summary: Former President Biden's secretary of Health and Human Services is strongly considering running for governor of California, according to allies.
386.author: Seema Mehta

387.title: Trump punishes Colombia for refusing entry to deportation flights
387.summary: He slaps a 25% tariff on Colombian goods and imposes a raft of visa restrictions. Latin American nations are grappling with how to deal with Trump on his signature issue.
387.author: Tracy Wilkinson

388.title: Column: The rise of Silicon Valley, from indifference to lords of the political universe
388.summary: The assembly of billionaires at Trump's inauguration was a display of wealth and power unlike any before. The display was all the more remarkable given how recently many in tech were politically naive or apathetic.
388.author: Mark Z. Barabak

389.title: Trump talks 'free speech' while moving to muzzle those he disagrees with
389.summary: President Trump issued an executive order purporting to end government censorship. Critics scoffed, saying his actions do just the opposite.
389.author: Kevin Rector

390.title: California's growing need for caregivers could collide with a crackdown on immigrants
390.summary: The Trump administration's plans to crack down on immigration and launch mass deportations could drain caregivers from the workforce as California and the country face the needs of an aging population, advocates and experts say.
390.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

391.title: Abcarian: Does Donald Trump's return to power mean it's time to admit he's right? In a word, no
391.summary: Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde's plea to Trump the day after his inauguration exemplified the principled criticism the president deserves regardless of his victory.
391.author: Robin Abcarian

392.title: Opinion: Trump promised to end the Ukraine war, but neither side is ready
392.summary: As Eisenhower once said of how conflicts end, 'sometimes it just gets down to the dirty job of killing until one side or the other cracks.'
392.author: ML Cavanaugh

393.title: Stranded in Mexico City, these migrants hoping to reach the United States have no good options
393.summary: The 1,500 migrants living in this Mexico City encampment face hard choices with President Trump in office.
393.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

394.title: Community groups set up strike teams to respond to Trump's mass deportation plans
394.summary: Community groups are dusting off the rapid-response networks they built during President Trump's first administration to prepare for immigration sweeps in California's agricultural heartland.
394.author: Rebecca Plevin

395.title: Visiting L.A. after firestorm, Trump focuses on overhauling California water policy
395.summary: President Trump says he plans to issue an order to 'open up the pumps' and deliver more water from the Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta to California farms and cities.
395.author: Ian James

396.title: Supreme Court will decide if religious schools may be funded as public charters
396.summary: The Supreme Court agreed to hear a new church-state case that could yield a potentially momentous decision and change the funding of public schools in much of the nation.
396.author: David G. Savage

397.title: Trump revokes the security detail of Dr. Anthony Fauci, who has faced death threats
397.summary: Trump revoked the security for Dr. Anthony Fauci, the infectious disease expert and former advisor turned critic who faces regular threats to his life.
397.author: Associated Press and Times staff

398.title: Cease-fire in Gaza Strip was widely welcomed. It may not last. Here's why
398.summary: Powerful forces in Middle East and, now, in Washington working against truce lasting beyond its first phase.
398.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King

399.title: Opinion: It's now clear that America's death penalty is dying one generation at a time
399.summary: Capital punishment has continued to become rarer in recent years, and public opinion of the practice keeps growing dimmer with time.
399.author: Austin Sarat

400.title: Meet the first couples to wed as Thailand legalizes same-sex marriage
400.summary: Thailand has long been known as a haven for LGBTQ+ communities. It is only the third place in Asia to legalize same-sex marriage, behind Taiwan in 2019 and Nepal in 2023.
400.author: Stephanie Yang

401.title: Trump's rebuke to 'gender ideology' changes federal policy and sets up clash with California
401.summary: The executive order conflicts with laws in California and other blue states that forbid discrimination based on gender identity. The courts are expected to take up the issue.
401.author: David G. Savage

402.title: Under Trump, we could be flying blind when it comes to bird flu, other infectious diseases
402.summary: President Trump announced he's pulling the U.S. from the WHO. Now researchers are scrambling to understand what that means for the H5N1 bird flu pandemic.
402.author: Susanne Rust

403.title: Alawites wary as a post-Assad Syria takes shape
403.summary: Once Syria's most influential minority, Alawites struggle to move on from their association with a hated dictator.
403.author: Nabih Bulos

404.title: U.S. and Australia have long fought fires together. Climate change threatens joint efforts
404.summary: U.S. officials didn't even bother to ask Australia for help battling the Los Angeles fires.
404.author: Max Kim, Maria Petrakis

405.title: Less process than 'a traffic ticket': ACLU sues to stop Trump's fast-track deportation policy
405.summary: ACLU sues to stop Trump policy that allows immediate deportation of some immigrants. The new policy could pave the way for mass expulsions.
405.author: Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga

406.title: 'Scare tactic': Bonta slams Trump move targeting local officials over immigration
406.summary: The Department of Justice is planning to investigate and possibly prosecute state and local officials who hinder Trump administration immigration efforts.
406.author: Faith E. Pinho, Keri Blakinger, Ruben Vives

407.title: Calmes: President Trump's Jan. 6 pardons broke his promise to the nation
407.summary: The new/old president seems to have a memory issue. 'You will pay,' he told Jan. 6 lawbreakers in 2021. You're free to go, he said Monday.
407.author: Jackie Calmes

408.title: 'Freaked out': Fear, uncertainty grip California's immigrant community as Trump rolls out crackdown plan
408.summary: Worry spreads over what Trump's orders will mean for California immigrants. One in eight state residents are undocumented or live with a family member who is.
408.author: Ruben Vives, Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga, Rebecca Plevin

409.title: Biden, Harris in California, and soon Trump will be too
409.summary: Former President Biden and former First Lady Jill Biden are spending their first days after leaving the White House in Santa Barbara County.
409.author: Seema Mehta

410.title: Musk says his gestures at Trump inauguration event weren't Nazi salutes
410.summary: Musk made the gestures during a giddy speech celebrating Trump's return to power at a rally Monday at Capital One Arena in Washington. Many condemn the gestures, but not the ADL.
410.author: Kevin Rector

411.title: What did Trump's team learn from past legal battles? Immigrant advocates prepare to find out
411.summary: Immigrants rights groups are already contesting President Trump's sweeping executive orders aimed at combating illegal immigration.
411.author: Andrea Castillo

412.title: Mexico's president reacts to Trump moves on immigration, border and cartels. 'It's nothing new'
412.summary: Mexico's President Sheinbaum says she will work with Trump on deportations, border issues and cartels, but laughs at his 'Gulf of America' order.
412.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

413.title: Jan. 6 rioters freed by Trump include Californians and those who assaulted officers
413.summary: Rioters who were convicted and imprisoned for their roles in the violent attack on the Capitol on Jan. 6 were being released after receiving pardons and commutations from Trump.
413.author: Brittny Mejia, Kevin Rector

414.title: Column: How Donald Trump's second inauguration outdid the cruelty and excesses of his first
414.summary: The president freed the Jan. 6 insurrectionists, disparaged California firefighters and welcomed the members of a new American oligarchy to Washington.
414.author: Robin Abcarian

415.title: California, other states sue to block Trump executive order on birthright citizenship
415.summary: California, a coalition of other states and the city of San Francisco have sued the Trump administration over President Trump's executive order aimed at ending birthright citizenship, calling it unconstitutional.
415.author: Kevin Rector

416.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar says she used her access to nudge Trump on L.A. wildfire recovery
416.summary: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar, the chief of the inaugural transition, acknowledged the difficulty of overseeing the handoff of power to President Trump in the site where his followers sought to violently overturn his election defeat four years ago.
416.author: Seema Mehta

417.title: Trump orders federal agencies to recognize only two sexes that are 'not changeable'
417.summary: President Trump signed executive orders Monday asserting that the U.S. government recognizes only two sexes that are "not changeable," and reversing Biden administration directives on LGBTQ+ rights.
417.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

418.title: 'Drill baby drill': Trump takes aim at clean energy, climate change and the environment on day one
418.summary: In his first day as the 47th U.S. president, Donald Trump took action to reverse many of the Biden administration's efforts to move the country toward a green-energy economy.
418.author: Tony Briscoe, Karen Kaplan

419.title: Trump pledges to restore McKinley's name to tallest peak in North America
419.summary: The pledge to rename Denali was opposed by environmental groups and Alaskan politicians, including Republican U.S. Sen. Lisa Murkowski.
419.author: Lila Seidman

420.title: Trump signs orders to crack down on immigration, send troops to the border
420.summary: President Trump signed executive orders that will fundamentally change how the nation handles immigration, beefing up enforcement and deportations.
420.author: Andrea Castillo, Rachel Uranga

421.title: Column: His first day back in office confirms it — there is no Trump 2.0
421.summary: President Trump promised an inaugural address focused on "unity," but what he delivered was long on promises and anger toward opponents.
421.author: Doyle McManus

422.title: 'We're taking it back.' Trump's comments on the Panama Canal spur pushback from Panama
422.summary: 'We're taking it back.' Trump inauguration speech claim that the U.S. will regain control of the Panama Canal spurs immediate reaction in Panama.
422.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

423.title: Trump immediately flexes presidential powers: 1,500 pardons and a raft of executive orders
423.summary: President Trump flexed his presidential powers Monday, promising executive orders to usher in his agenda. He issued 1,500 pardons, after President Biden issued his own.
423.author: Kevin Rector

424.title: Scenes from a packed Rotunda: Moguls, former presidents — and some notable absences
424.summary: Hundreds of the world's most powerful people — among them every living president as well as billionaire tech executives — were crammed cheek-by-jowl in the 7,200-square-foot Capitol Rotunda.
424.author: Seema Mehta

425.title: Disappointment at border as Trump cancels immigration program
425.summary: The Trump administration cancelled a program aimed at easing the process of applying for asylum, leaving thousands of asylum-seekers disappointed and unsure of what to do next.
425.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

426.title: It's below freezing in D.C., but Trump supporters are thrilled to be present
426.summary: Most people who traveled to Washington to watch the event in person have been relegated to the Capital One Arena, a sports venue nearby, for a livestream of the official ceremony.
426.author: Faith E. Pinho, Seema Mehta, Hailey Branson-Potts

427.title: Opinion: It's time to relearn the lessons of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense'
427.summary: The revolutionary rallying cry 'Common Sense' — challenging authoritarian rule, countering the sway of the wealthy and upholding the will of the majority — is as relevant in 2025 as it was in 1776.
427.author: A.T. McWilliams

428.title: Trump is sworn in as the nation's 47th president, capping historic comeback
428.summary: Donald Trump took the oath of office to become the 47th president in a historic Inauguration Day.
428.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho, James Rainey, Hailey Branson-Potts

429.title: RFK Jr. wants to improve Americans' health. Here's some advice from the outgoing FDA chief
429.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has big plans for the FDA if he's confirmed as Secretary of Health and Human Services. FDA Commissioner Robert Califf explains why certain changes may not be that easy — or desirable.
429.author: Karen Kaplan

430.title: Cease-fire between Israel and Hamas begins with hostages being handed over
430.summary: Three hostages were handed over to Israeli forces — the first of 33 expected to be freed over the next six weeks in exchange for some 1,900 Palestinians. The deal follows months of negotiations.
430.author: Nabih Bulos, Bilal Shbair

431.title: News Analysis: Once again, the world sizes up a Trump presidency
431.summary: As Donald Trump takes the oath of office again, the world watches with a sense that, this time, those outside the U.S. have a better idea what to expect.
431.author: Laura King, Tracy Wilkinson

432.title: Opinion: If Martin Luther King Jr. were alive, how would he have approached the Trump era?
432.summary: The president-elect's inauguration takes place on the holiday honoring the civil rights leader, prompting us to consider how King might respond to Trump's America.
432.author: Earl Ofari Hutchinson

433.title: Opinion: Experts once thought highly of Biden's presidency. Here's how his legacy is likely to change
433.summary: A year ago, a survey of presidential scholars put him in the top third of chief executives while Trump ranked last. But that was before the 2024 election and campaign.
433.author: Brandon Rottinghaus and Justin Vaughn

434.title: Trump's first inaugural speech was 'American carnage.' He says this time will be different
434.summary: Will Trump take the opportunity this time, in his second inaugural speech, to talk of unity? Or will it be more 'American carnage'?
434.author: Doyle McManus

435.title: Column: Why's it so hard to do the right thing and honor the true heroes of Jan. 6?
435.summary: Nearly three years after passage of legislation to place a commemorative plaque on the western front of the Capitol there is still no action. Speaker Mike Johnson and other Trump allies are trying to bury history.
435.author: Mark Z. Barabak

436.title: Calmes: Biden delivered a new 'Roaring '20s.' Watch Trump try to take the credit
436.summary: No matter what the new president says, the facts show that Joe Biden left America in better economic shape than he found it.
436.author: Jackie Calmes

437.title: Supporters of South Korea's Yoon storm courthouse. Some see hope in Trump's return
437.summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's supporters storm the courthouse that issued a warrant extending his detention, climbing walls and smashing windows.
437.author: Max Kim

438.title: Trump expected to survey Los Angeles-area wildfire damage this week
438.summary: President-elect Donald Trump, in perhaps his first official trip after being inaugurated Monday, will likely visit the Los Angeles area to survey wildfire damage late next week.
438.author: Seema Mehta

439.title: Supreme Court will decide if parents may reject LGBTQ+ lessons for their kids
439.summary: Supreme Court will take up a dispute over grade school textbooks that include LGBTQ+ themes, pitting religious rights against individual rights.
439.author: David G. Savage

440.title: Brad Pitt's team reminds fans he's not on social media after a woman gets big-time scammed
440.summary: Brad Pitt is not on social media, his team reminded fans, after a French woman said she was conned out of $800,000 by scammers posing as the A-list actor.
440.author: Nardine Saad

441.title: Supreme Court upholds law that could force TikTok to shut down in U.S.
441.summary: Congress and now the Supreme Court say TikTok must separate itself from its Chinese owners or shut down operations in the U.S.
441.author: David G. Savage

442.title: Joan Plowright, award-winning 'Enchanted April' and 'Stalin' actor, dies at 95
442.summary: Joan Plowright, the celebrated English actor whose career included the films 'Enchanted April,' 'The Entertainer' and 'Spiderwick Chronicles,' has died at 95.
442.author: Alexandra Del Rosario

443.title: Opinion: What a century-old disaster can teach fire-ravaged L.A. about recovery and rebuilding
443.summary: Some in the fire-ravaged city have taken to laying personal blame. But what endures from the Canadian disaster is the generosity of those who helped rebuild.
443.author: Ben Proudfoot

444.title: Migration across the U.S.-Mexico border, in 5 charts
444.summary: Arrivals at the border are the lowest they've been since incoming President Trump first left office in 2021.
444.author: Andrea Castillo, Koko Nakajima

445.title: Trump made many 'Day 1' promises. Will he make good on them?
445.summary: President-elect Donald Trump could start taking action Monday on his many "Day 1" campaign promises, but California officials and others are ready to fight.
445.author: Kevin Rector

446.title: Bitter feud among Sinaloa cartel families brings grim new tactic: Grave desecration
446.summary: In the escalating war among rival factions of Mexico's Sinaloa cartel, sons of Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán are suspected of ordering the destruction of elaborate mausoleums that belong to rival families, including one for a fallen grandson of Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada.
446.author: Keegan Hamilton

447.title: Fire lessons from the Australian capital, where a 2003 inferno changed everything
447.summary: Two decades ago, fire ripped through Canberra, destroying 480 homes. An Australian fire chief reflects on possible lessons for California.
447.author: Max Kim

448.title: Padilla hopes to increase firefighter pay, create affordable housing for disaster response
448.summary: California Sen. Alex Padilla introduced several bills to increase firefighter pay, expand FEMA funding and include affordable housing as part of disaster response.
448.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho

449.title: Harris joins a decades-old tradition for vice presidents in her final days in office
449.summary: Vice President Kamala Harris, in one of her last public appearances in the role, signed her ceremonial desk drawer at the White House on Thursday, a tradition that dates back nearly a century.
449.author: Seema Mehta

450.title: Rep. Nancy Pelosi will not attend Trump's inauguration
450.summary: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-San Francisco) will not attend the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump.
450.author: Kevin Rector

451.title: Victims urge international court to probe Kenya abductions
451.summary: Victims and their families in Kenya have called on the international criminal court (ICC) to investigate a wave of kidnappings and extrajudicial killings linked to security forces. Since anti-government protests in June, over 60 killings and 89 abductions have been reported. Human rights groups accuse police of conducting forced disappearances and killings. Recent discoveries of tortured bodies and testimonies from survivors have heightened concerns, prompting calls for ICC intervention.

452.title: Donald Trump calls Elon 'smart', 'big cost-cutter'; Musk says, 'I love him more'
452.summary: "I think Elon is doing a good job. He's a big cost-cutter. Sometimes we won't agree with it. It will not go where he wants to go. But he is doing a great job. He’s a smart guy… he's very much into cutting the budget of our federal government," Trump said. Elon Musk also made some public comments about Donald Trump in the first-ever X Space on DOGE & Mars, which he hosted at midnight yesterday. The more I’ve gotten to know President Trump, the more I like him. I love the guy; he’s great," Elon Musk said.
452.author: TOI World Desk

453.title: How Trump overturned 87-year-old loophole to make Chinese companies hurt
453.author: TOI World Desk

454.title: Pope lists tragedies of children in war and trafficking at a rights summit
454.summary: Pope Francis hosted a summit in Rome focusing on protecting children from war, exploitation, trafficking, and forced labor. The summit highlighted the violations of children's rights worldwide, especially in conflict zones like Gaza. Queen Rania of Jordan, Holocaust survivor Liliana Segre, and other leaders emphasized the urgent need to protect children, referring to the UN convention on the rights of the child. Pope Francis also drew attention to the plight of stateless children and refugees, while also acknowledging the Church's struggles with its own history of abuse.

455.title: Blast in an upscale residential area in Moscow kills 1 and leaves 4 wounded
455.summary: A blast in a Moscow residential block on Monday killed one person and injured four others, with the wounded in critical condition. The cause of the explosion is unclear, but law enforcement has launched a criminal investigation, charging murder and attempted murder. Among the injured was Armen Sarkisyan, founder of a volunteer battalion fighting in Ukraine, whose bodyguard died in the blast. Sarkisyan is wanted in Ukraine, though details of the charges remain unspecified.

456.title: No aid in USAID? What is the full form of USAID? What does USAID stand for?
456.author: TOI World Desk

457.title: Elon Musk believes ‘working the weekend is superpower’ - know why
457.summary: Elon Musk has reignited the work-life balance debate by calling working on weekends a 'superpower.' This comes amidst global discussions on work ethics and balance. While some support his philosophy, critics argue it could lead to burnout. Similar comments from other corporate leaders have stirred debates and controversies regarding work culture and employee well-being.
457.author: TOI World Desk

458.title: Kyiv army boss urges probe after attacks on recruitment centres
458.summary: Ukraine's army chief, Oleksandr Syrsky, called for an investigation into recent violent attacks on military recruitment centers and officials. A recruitment officer was killed in Poltava, while blasts hit centers in Pavlograd and Rivne, leaving one dead and several injured. Authorities are investigating, but coordination between incidents remains unclear. Amid recruitment struggles, many men evade enlistment, prompting concerns over public support for the military and national defense.

459.title: Over 200 undersea earthquakes hit Greece's Santorini, authorities on high alert
459.summary: Authorities have heightened precautions on Santorini, Greece, following over 200 undersea earthquakes, some up to 4.8 in magnitude, raising earthquake concerns. Schools are closed, and emergency protocols activated for Santorini and nearby islands. Experts provide some reassurance, but residents remain anxious as tremors continue. Temporary shelters and emergency crews are in place as some locals evacuate.
459.author: TOI World Desk

460.title: Video: Teen pulls gun on elderly man—gets fatally shot instead
460.summary: A 78-year-old man in Buenos Aires fatally shot a 15-year-old boy who attempted to rob him outside his home. The incident was captured on surveillance footage, showing the teenager holding a fake gun. Authorities have determined that the retiree acted in clear self-defense and will not face charges.
460.author: TOI World Desk

461.title: USAID officials placed on leave after denying DOGE access to classified data
461.summary: Two top security officials at the US Agency for International Development (USAID) were placed on administrative leave after refusing to grant access to Elon Musk’s DOGE team. The Trump administration increased control over federal agencies, leading to more suspensions and resignations at USAID.
461.author: TOI World Desk

462.title: Elon Musk mocks Senator’s criticism over DOGE controversy
462.summary: Senator Elizabeth Warren has criticized Elon Musk for allegedly having unchecked influence over government operations under President Trump. Musk's role in the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has sparked controversy, with concerns about misuse of sensitive taxpayer data and calls for transparency and efficiency. Supporters and critics voiced strong opinions on social media.
462.author: TOI World Desk

463.title: Businesses, workers join ‘a day without immigrants’ protest across US
463.summary: On February 3, businesses across the US, including restaurants and retail shops, will shut down as part of 'A Day Without Immigrants' protest. The movement aims to highlight the essential role of immigrants in the economy, while emphasizing their financial contributions and calling for broader discussions on immigration policies.
463.author: TOI World Desk

464.title: At least 15 killed in car bomb explosion in northern Syria
464.summary: A car bomb exploded on the outskirts of Manbij, Syria, killing at least 15 people, mostly women, and injuring dozens. The vehicle targeted was carrying agricultural workers. Conflicting reports suggest varying casualty numbers. Manbij has seen continued violence due to clashes between Turkish-backed factions and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces.

465.title: Syria's first female football coach hoping for new era
465.summary: Syria's first female football coach, Maha Janoud, reflects on her journey from war-torn Syria to coaching in Iceland. Despite regime change, she hopes for accountability and a fair future for her homeland. While optimistic about men's football, she is cautious about the future of women's sports under the new government.

466.title: Anti-war Russian Orthodox priests struggle in German exile
466.summary: Orthodox priests from Russia are facing repression for opposing Russian policies and the invasion of Ukraine. Many have fled, facing difficulties in resettling, such as finding jobs and learning new skills. Organizations like Peace unto All provide financial support. Some priests have found new roles in European countries, but challenges remain significant.

467.title: Saudi Arabia wants to support Syria, says al-Sharaa
467.summary: Syria's interim president, Ahmad al-Sharaa, visited Saudi Arabia for his first international trip since taking power. He met with Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to discuss support for Syria's future and lifting international sanctions. The visit aligns Syria closer with Saudi Arabia, moving away from its previous ally, Iran.

468.title: A bite too hard: Marriage proposal goes wrong after girlfriend chews gold ring hidden in cake
468.summary: A Chinese man's proposal went awry when his girlfriend accidentally ate the engagement ring hidden in a cake. The humorous mishap, shared on social media, quickly went viral, with netizens sharing amusing reactions and advising against using food for proposals. The girlfriend later accepted the proposal despite the initial misunderstanding.
468.author: TOI World Desk

469.title: No Jack Daniel's, Bacardi Rum, Jim Beam in Canada: US alcohol brands start coming off shelves in tariff war
469.summary: Government-run liquor stores in British Columbia are removing US-made alcohol brands from Republican-led states following American tariffs on Canadian goods. Canadian provinces are following suit, promoting domestic products and urging citizens to buy Canadian-made items. The move responds to tariffs imposed by Donald Trump targeting Canadian imports.
469.author: TOI World Desk

470.title: Chinese firm under fire for clicking photos of employees in washroom to shame them over long breaks
470.summary: A Chinese company, Lixun Diansheng, faced backlash for photographing employees in the restroom and displaying the images publicly as a warning against long breaks. This act, intended to deter misuse of bathroom time, was widely condemned online for violating privacy and human dignity. The company later removed the images, acknowledging they 'did not look good,' but criticism about the ethical and legal violations persisted.
470.author: TOI World Desk

471.title: FBI agents ordered to disclose their roles in Capitol riot probes – media
471.summary:
The US Justice Department has reportedly launched a review of the January 6 probes amid concerns of a political purge
Read Full Article at RT.com
471.author: RT

472.title: Ukraine renews efforts to seize Russian assets – WaPo
472.summary:
Kiev has renewed its push to seize frozen Russian assets following Donald Trump’s reelection as US president, the Washington Post reports
Read Full Article at RT.com
472.author: RT

473.title: ‘Transgender’ references removed from US State Dept advisories
473.summary:
The State Department has dropped three letters from the LGBTQI+ acronym on its travel page as part of a push against transgender protections
Read Full Article at RT.com
473.author: RT

474.title: USAID run by ‘a bunch of radical lunatics’ – Trump
474.summary:
The Elon Musk-headed Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) reportedly audited the agency’s systems last week
Read Full Article at RT.com
474.author: RT

475.title: Talks with Russia and Ukraine ‘going pretty well’ – Trump
475.summary:
The US has meetings scheduled with Russia and Ukraine, with the discussions making progress, Donald Trump has said
Read Full Article at RT.com
475.author: RT

476.title: Ex-British MP joins Ukrainian army – Independent
476.summary:
Former British MP Giacomo Lopresti has joined the Ukrainian military with aspiration to become an officer, according to The Independent
Read Full Article at RT.com
476.author: RT

477.title: Panama to scrap key deal with China
477.summary:
Panama will not renew its participation in China’s Belt and Road Initiative, President Jose Raul Mulino has announced
Read Full Article at RT.com
477.author: RT

478.title: Tariffs could cause ‘some pain’ – Trump
478.summary:
Donald Trump admits that Americans could face an economic impact from new tariffs on Canada, Mexico, and China
Read Full Article at RT.com
478.author: RT

479.title: Rubio delivers Trump’s ultimatum to Panama
479.summary:
US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has urged Panama to reduce Chinese influence over the Panama Canal or face potential US retaliation
Read Full Article at RT.com
479.author: RT

480.title: Zelensky has no idea where most of ‘$200 billion’ in US aid went
480.summary:
Kiev has received far less US aid than the amount cited by President Donald Trump, Ukrainian leader Vladimir Zelensky has claimed
Read Full Article at RT.com
480.author: RT

481.title: Musk accuses USAID of ‘covering up corruption’
481.summary:
The White House has reportedly placed two USAID security officials on leave for barring DOGE inspectors from accessing intelligence reports
Read Full Article at RT.com
481.author: RT

482.title: USAID funded bioweapon research – Musk
482.summary:
Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk has accused the US Agency for International Development (USAID) of financing bioweapon research
Read Full Article at RT.com
482.author: RT

483.title: Israel demolishes dozens of buildings in West Bank (VIDEO)
483.summary:
The Israeli military has blown up more than 20 buildings in the city of Jenin in the West Bank as part of a “counterterrorist operation”
Read Full Article at RT.com
483.author: RT

484.title: Musk urges astronauts to lead Mars investigation
484.summary:
The billionaire has called for a mysterious formation on the Red Planet to be explored
Read Full Article at RT.com
484.author: RT

485.title: Member state calls on NATO to ‘show muscle’
485.summary:
NATO should build up its presence on Russia’s doorstep in the Baltic Sea, Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda has said
Read Full Article at RT.com
485.author: RT

486.title: The German right wing has just scored a big breakthrough – or has it?
486.summary:
The likely next chancellor wants to adopt the right-wing AfD’s migration policies while still sidelining the party itself
Read Full Article at RT.com
486.author: RT

487.title: Trump renews call for Canada to join US
487.summary:
The American president cited the trade benefits and military protection that Ottawa would receive amid an escalating tariff dispute
Read Full Article at RT.com
487.author: RT

488.title: Violence against females in UK increasing – watchdog
488.summary:
The UK’s efforts to address violence against females have failed to improve outcomes for victims, the National Audit Office has reported
Read Full Article at RT.com
488.author: RT

695.title: Can We Still Solve Climate Change?
695.summary:
SAN FRANCISCO, California / APEX, North Carolina, Jan 31 (IPS) - When it comes to climate change, the awful news has been coming thick and fast. We now know that in 2024, the Earth’s average temperature exceeded 1.5°C above pre-industrial levels for the first time.

Read the full story, “Can We Still Solve Climate Change?”, on globalissues.org →

696.title: Explainer: Why Glaciers Are Alive, Life-Giving and Worth Preserving
696.summary:
Jan 31 (IPS) - The United Nations declared 2025 as the International Year of Glaciers’ Preservation to promote awareness about the role of glaciers, snow and ice. The climate system and global hydrological cycle are dependent on accumulated water in solid form as glaciers, snow and ice. Because of the global temperature rise and its impact on the Earth’s cryosphere, socio-economic and environmental effects are being observed.

Read the full story, “Explainer: Why Glaciers Are Alive, Life-Giving and Worth Preserving”, on globalissues.org →

697.title: Gaza Humanitarian Aid: How a Lack of Political Will Sabotaged Resolution 2720
697.summary:
UNITED NATIONS, Jan 31 (IPS) - Before the three-phased ceasefire deal—proposed by President Joe Biden and dragged over the finish line by the then-incoming Donald Trump administration—silenced the bombs and drones over Gaza and allowed for humanitarian aid to flow into the strip, there was United Nations Security Council Resolution 2720.

Read the full story, “Gaza Humanitarian Aid: How a Lack of Political Will Sabotaged Resolution 2720”, on globalissues.org →

698.title: The Road to and from Wuhan: Is Trump a Threat to Global Health?
698.summary:
STOCKHOLM, Sweden, Jan 31 (IPS) - On his first day in office, President Donald Trump signed an executive order withdrawing the U.S. from the World Health Organization (WHO) – a move experts say makes the U.S. and other countries less safe from infectious diseases and other public-health threats. It might thus be opportune to return to the global COVID 19 pandemic. Has the threat really gone away? Can something similar not erupt again?

Read the full story, “The Road to and from Wuhan: Is Trump a Threat to Global Health?”, on globalissues.org →

699.title: Safeguarding Civil Society - a New Global Initiative Could Become a Game-Changer
699.summary:
JOHANNESBURG, Jan 31 (IPS) - Across the world, civil society faces increasing pressure—from restrictive laws on civil society operations to digital surveillance, funding restrictions, and direct attacks on human rights defenders. In response, a global civil society coalition is stepping up. The newly launched European Union System for an Enabling Environment for Civil Society (EU SEE) spans 86 countries, equipping civil society actors, governments and other stakeholders with the data, tools, and resources needed to anticipate and respond in real time to shifts in the enabling environment—ensuring that civil society can thrive, freely express itself, and actively shape its context.

Read the full story, “Safeguarding Civil Society - a New Global Initiative Could Become a Game-Changer”, on globalissues.org →

700.title: Genocide 2.0—Trump’s Plan for Cleansing Gaza
700.summary:
ATLANTA, USA, Jan 31 (IPS) - Either the new US President, Mr. Trump, is ignorant of international law or thinks he’s so brilliant that he doesn’t care about it. Either way, he seems to have stumbled into proposing an extension of Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu’s clearly documented crime of genocide by suggesting that somebody “clear out” the people in Gaza, in effect advocating the ethnic cleansing of the territory.
